page.title: 14Bretch Hill Social Problems
page.content: Banbury's Bretch Hill area was built in the early 1960's as a council estate. In the mid 1970's came a small amount of private housing. The estate built by agreement with the G.L.C. gave 80% of the houses to London families, 15% to Birmingham, and 5% for local rehousing. Since building ended about 10 years ago the estate has become more stable. Unemployment is high with many young people jobless. Some unskilled workers have very low paid jobs. As a result of this nearly half the school children are entitled to free school meals and many families are very short of money. There are a high number of broken marriages leaving 1 child in 3 supported by a single parent. Other children have a step parent. This means that nearly half of all children have experienced great changes.
